reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: U.S - China Aviation Technical Assistance (ATA) Workshops Phase III

description.narrative: Support the creation, improvement and sustainability of physical infrastructure, and related services, in both urban and rural areas, to enhance the economic environment and improve economic productivity, including for women. The main infrastructures include energy, including electric power transmission lines and distribution networks, oil/gas terminals, refineries, storage facilities and pipelines; telecom and ICT; and transport, including roads, airports, railways, and ports.

This award supports the creation, improvement and sustainability of physical infrastructure, and related services, in both urban and rural areas, to enhance the economic environment and improve economic productivity, including for women,. More specifically, this award includes a Agreement with USTDA/FAA to provide technical assistance and training components under the ATA Workshops Phase III in coordination with the U.S.-China Aviation Cooperation Program (ACP)..

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Office of Policy, International Affairs, and Environment

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

mailing-address.narrative: 1200 New Jersey Ave, SE Washington, DC 20590

description.narrative: U.S.~assistance helps Tibetan communities improve livelihoods, promote sustainable development and environmental conservation, and preserve cultural traditions. In addition, foreign assistance funding also supports targeted programs that strengthen cooperation on combatting the spread of HIV/AIDS and other pandemic and emerging diseases as well as rule of law programs.
Travel expenses for eight (8) FAA participants to attend the workshops in China and coordinate with ACP prior to the workshops.

sector.narrative: Education and training in transport and storage

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Trade and Development Agency, Funds Appropriated to the President
